remarks: The group power of a difference is the group quotient of the powers. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Apr-2009.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
gxsub.1 $e |- X = ran G $.
gxsub.2 $e |- N = ( inv ` G ) $.
gxsub.3 $e |- P = ( ^g ` G ) $.
gxsub $p |- ( ( G e. GrpOp /\ A e. X /\ ( J e. ZZ /\ K e. ZZ ) ) -> ( A P ( J - K ) ) = ( ( A P J ) G ( N ` ( A P K ) ) ) ) $.
